text: Sai Baba of Shirdi (d. October 15, 1918) was a spiritual master who lived in India. His followers believed that he was a saint. He lived the longest part of his life in a village in India called Shirdi. Although Sai Baba died almost 100 years ago, still today large numbers of people follow him or have great respect for him. He is very well respected in India, both by Hindus and Muslims. There are many temples built all over India to honor Sai Baba of Shirdi. ==References== Category:Year of birth unknown Category:1918 deaths Category:Indian religious leaders Category:Spiritual teachers Category:People from Maharashtra
title: Sai Baba of Shirdi
